â€˜THE HOLY TERRORâ€™

Please feel free to comment on my review.

A Side-Step into a 2-D Universe with the Sixth Doctor and Frobisher

Itâ€™s time for us to venture intoâ€¦â€˜The Holy Terrorâ€™!

No! No! Not â€˜Batman: Holy Terrorâ€™! This is the â€˜Doctor Whoâ€™ audio adventure called â€˜The Holy Terrorâ€™! Look, you know this is a â€˜Doctor Whoâ€™ story that Iâ€™m reviewing. I started off this review with the Big Finish audio CD cover at the top of this page for goodness sake! So thereâ€™s no need to refer to another story called â€˜Holyâ€¦â€™

(put-off) I donâ€™t want to think about that one.

Although quite ironically, this â€˜Doctor Whoâ€™ audio adventure does connect to a character that features in the â€˜Doctor Whoâ€™ comics. Iâ€™m of course talking about Frobisher, the shape-shifting companion of the Sixth Doctor, who very often looks like a big talking penguin in the comic stories.

I must admit, Iâ€™ve not read many â€˜Doctor Whoâ€™ comics. Iâ€™ve read the Fifth Doctor comics and one half of the Eighth Doctor comics by â€˜Doctor Who Magazineâ€™. Iâ€™ve also checked out a couple of the Titan â€˜Doctor Whoâ€™ comic adventures like â€˜The Many Lives of Doctor Whoâ€™ and â€˜Defender of the Daleksâ€™. ğŸ™‚

Iâ€™ve also read the â€˜Doctor Whoâ€™/â€˜Star Trekâ€™ crossover called â€˜Assmilation2â€˜. But when it comes to talking about Frobisher as a â€˜Doctor Whoâ€™ companion in the comics, Iâ€™ve still a lot to learn about him. I know that he featured in the â€˜DWMâ€™ comics with the Sixth and Seventh Doctors in the mid-1980s. ğŸ™‚

Mostly, he was with the Sixth Doctor in the â€˜Doctor Whoâ€™ comics. Iâ€™ve also checked out his appearance in the IDW comic â€˜Prisoners of Timeâ€™, which celebrated â€˜Doctor Whoâ€™s 50th anniversary. Frobisher has also appeared in the BBC â€˜Past Doctors Adventuresâ€™ book called â€˜Mission: Impracticalâ€™.

There are also â€˜Doctor Whoâ€™ adventures featuring the Sixth Doctor, Peri and Frobisher by Alan Camlann (Wolfie) of the Divergent Wordsmiths, including â€˜Eden of Annihilationâ€™ and the upcoming story â€˜The Alchemists of Fearâ€™. Iâ€™m currently working with Alan Camlann/Wolfie on a third â€˜Doctor Whoâ€™ story featuring the Fifth Doctor, Nyssa and Billy meeting the Sixth Doctor, Peri and Frobisher. ğŸ™‚

Wolfie: Hi, all! If youâ€™re looking for more of the big talking bird, â€˜Eden By Annihilationâ€™ is available now for reading. Taking influence from stories like â€˜Arcaneâ€™, â€˜Thunderbirdsâ€™, â€˜Life is Strangeâ€™, â€˜Oxenfreeâ€™, and â€˜She-Ra and the Princesses of Powerâ€™; it tells of the Sixth Doctor, Peri and Frobisherâ€™s struggle against a newly awakened living planet. The Doctor tries to understand it whilst the companions hope to find a means to escape it. This is a story that could only be told with this TARDIS team. Their friendships, their hardships, their personal tragedies and their triumphs. This is a team that will fight to the last breath, and thereâ€™s so much on the line in â€˜Edenâ€™ to justify it.

Coming up is â€˜The Alchemists of Fearâ€™, which will take the Sixth Doctor, Peri and Frobisher into a world being used as a living experiment. Its people at the mercy of a conclave that have the means to dominate â€“ or to destroy â€“ every living thing under their wide influence. Even on the back foot, the Doctor and his friends are determined to see the danger through. Whatever the cost to themselves. But are they prepared for it? Truly? And will it be enough this time?

And soon, two unique groups of Doctors and companions clash and coincide onâ€¦ Well, Tim and I will be able to talk more on that as things develop. ğŸ™‚

Check out â€˜Eden By Annihilationâ€™, the Frobisher solo story â€˜Ask Nicelyâ€™ in â€˜Unbound Imaginings: Volume 2â€™, and stay tuned for further stories, hopefully sooner rather than later. Bye for now!

Thanks, Wolfie!

When it comes to talking about Frobisherâ€™s audio appearances in â€˜Doctor Whoâ€™ by Big Finish, theyâ€™re very rare. As of 2022, there are two audio stories featuring the Sixth Doctor and Frobisher, including â€˜The Holy Terrorâ€™ and â€˜The Maltese Penguinâ€™. I find this very surprising to find out about Frobisher. ğŸ˜

Youâ€™d think that Big Finish would make more audio adventures featuring the Sixth Doctor and Frobisher, especially since â€˜The Holy Terrorâ€™ is one of Big Finishâ€™s earliest monthly range adventures. â€˜The Holy Terrorâ€™ was released in 2000 whilst â€˜The Maltese Penguinâ€™ was released in 2002. Very odd!

I would like it if Big Finish made more â€˜Doctor Whoâ€™ audio stories featuring Frobisher. Perhaps box set stories of the Sixth Doctor, Peri and Frobisher could happen. I would welcome audio adaptations of the comic book adventures featuring Frobisher in â€˜Doctor Whoâ€™. As is, this hasnâ€™t happened yet. ğŸ˜

I must get around to checking out more Frobisher stories in â€˜Doctor Whoâ€™ in comic form. For now though, letâ€™s talk about â€˜The Holy Terrorâ€™ as an audio adventure featuring the Sixth Doctor and Frobisher. After hearing it, I find it to be one of the best â€˜Doctor Whoâ€™ audio stories ever produced. ğŸ™‚

It was even rated highly by fans as one of the top five favourite â€˜Doctor Whoâ€™ monthly audio adventures by Big Finish in 2021. Itâ€™s no surprise â€˜The Holy Terrorâ€™ has been rated highly, as itâ€™s a four-part audio story by Robert Shearman, well-known for writing the â€˜Doctor Whoâ€™ episode â€˜Dalekâ€™.

Since seeing â€˜Dalekâ€™, Iâ€™ve checked out quite a number of â€˜Doctor Whoâ€™ stories by Robert Shearman in audio form. As well as â€˜The Holy Terrorâ€™, heâ€™s also written stories like â€˜Jubileeâ€™, â€˜My Own Private Wolfgangâ€™ in â€˜100â€™, â€˜The Chimes of Midnightâ€™ and â€˜Scherzoâ€™. He comes across as a very good writer. ğŸ™‚

Iâ€™ve even met and chatted to Rob Shearman at conventions, including â€˜Regenerations 2011â€™ in Swansea, September 2011. I was surprised by the twist revelations featured in this story, especially when the world that the Sixth Doctor and Frobisher visited turned out to be not what they expected.

In the story, the TARDIS lands in a castle at a time of religious upheaval. One god has been overthrown and the heretics have been slaughtered. The Doctor and Frobisher get involved in the storyâ€™s events, hailed as messengers from heaven, before theyâ€™re caught in the struggle for power. ğŸ˜

Thereâ€™s certainly an underlying level of humour featured throughout the story, bordering on the lines of Douglas Adams-styled humour, I think. Rob Shearman clearly likes meshing in the balance of horror and comedy throughout this audio story and the direction by Nicholas Pegg is pretty well-handled.

Colin Baker stars as the Sixth Doctor in this audio adventure. I like how Colin gets into the story, joined by a penguin companion in Frobisher. This must be the first time Colin Bakerâ€™s done a Sixth Doctor story with Frobisher and he acts like heâ€™s been travelling with Frobisher for a really long time.

I really hope audio adaptations of the comic stories featuring the Sixth Doctor and Frobisher will happen someday, as I would like to hear how Colin Bakerâ€™s Doctor gets to meet Frobisher. The chemistry between Colin Baker and Robert Jezek is so good and I like the interaction between them.

Speaking of which, Robert Jezek plays Frobisher in the Big Finish audios of â€˜Doctor Whoâ€™. In the TV series, Robert Jezek played Sgt. Zbrigniev in â€˜Battlefieldâ€™ with Sylvester McCoy. Heâ€™s played other roles in Big Finish over the years, but Frobisher seems to be his most notable one in â€˜Doctor Whoâ€™. ğŸ™‚

I like how Robert Jezek puts across Frobisherâ€™s cynicism, especially when he gets hailed as a god at the end of â€˜Part Twoâ€™. I enjoyed the story Frobisher had when interacting with Pepin, especially when he was without the Doctor for a bit. It was amusing to think of statue built in Frobisherâ€™s image.

The guest cast includes Sam Kelly as Eugene Tacitus, the scribe at the castle. Sam Kelly played Captain Hans Geering in â€˜Allo â€˜Alloâ€™. He also played Acheron in â€˜Return to the Web Planetâ€™. I enjoyed Sam Kellyâ€™s performance as Eugene Tactius in the story. He also plays the Child featured in this story.

Thereâ€™s also Roberta Taylor as Berengaria, the mother of Pepin the Seventh. Roberta Taylor is well-known for playing Irene Raymond in â€˜EastEndersâ€™. In real life, sheâ€™s married to Peter Guinness, who plays her son Childreric. Yeah, I know. Weird! Berengaria comes across as a rather sulky character. ğŸ˜

As well as being Roberta Taylorâ€™s wife, Peter Guinness has been in â€˜Casualtyâ€™ and â€˜The Secret of Sleepy Hollowâ€™. Peter Guinness as Childreric is played out to be the main villain here. Quite frankly, there are lot of villains in this. As well as the Child and Childeric, thereâ€™s also Clovis, Arnulf and Livilla.

The cast also includes Daniel Hogarth as Captain Sejanus, Helen Punt as Livilla, Stefan Atkinson as Pepin the Seventh, Peter Sowerbutts as Clovis and Bruce Mann as Arnulf. Rob Shearman also plays a sculptor and a guard whilst Gary Russell plays another guard and Jacqueline Rayner plays a woman. ğŸ˜€

A lot of these characters can be mean-spirited, especially when they perform their function in an over-zealous and religious society. Pepin the Seventh seems to be the only nice character featured throughout this story. But things do make sense when you get to the revelation of who made this world.

The CD extras are as follows. At the end of Disc 2, thereâ€™s a â€˜coming soonâ€™ trailer for â€˜The Mutant Phaseâ€™ with Peter Davison and Sarah Sutton. Thereâ€™s also an outtake from â€˜The Holy Terrorâ€™, which youâ€™ll have to wait for or fast forward to at the end of the last track of Disc 2.

â€˜The Holy Terrorâ€™ has been an invigorating â€˜Doctor Whoâ€™ audio adventure to listen to, featuring Colin Baker as the Sixth Doctor and Robert Jezek as Frobisher. I enjoyed Robert Shearmanâ€™s take on the Sixth Doctor and Frobisher. Itâ€™s been a fun adventure filled with comedic and quite dark overtones. ğŸ™‚

Hopefully after hearing â€˜The Holy Terrorâ€™, Iâ€™ll be able to get onto to checking out more â€˜Doctor Whoâ€™ stories featuring the Sixth Doctor and Frobisher, both in comic and prose form. My next port of call will be the audio story â€˜The Maltese Penguinâ€™. Iâ€™m curious as to how the Sixth Doctor and Frobisher will fare out in that.

â€œAll hail Frobisher! All hail the big talking bird!â€ ğŸ˜€

â€˜The Holy Terrorâ€™ rating â€“ 9/10
